metadata.synopsis: The players have a conversation with the 'beastmaster' - an engineer who operates the Submersible. The player can either be sent here by Allandra to kill the beastmaster, or stumble here after following clues from the Steelwatch Foundry and want a way to get to the Iron Throne. They can also stumble upon it first, before getting any clues about it.The beastmaster works for Gortash, operating the submersible to transfer people and items to and from the Iron Throne The beastmaster can be talked into taking the players to the Iron Throne using the submersible. If he's killed instead, players will have other ways of finding the needed information and/or items to use the submersible on their own.The beastmaster should make it clear that he would not step out into the Iron Throne itself.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to the beastmaster located in the Dock Warehouse basement.

2.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
2.text: Don't get your grubby paws all over Cap. What do you want?
2.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

58.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
58.text: Didn't I tell you to feck off?
58.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

88.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
88.text: Gortash doesn't mess around. If you're fool enough to go back, I'll be fool enough to take you. Just jump in.
88.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

118.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
118.text: Oi, what's this? You ain't supposed to be down here, mate.
118.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *A submersible - it matches the description of the vehicle that brought the Gondian hostages into the Iron Throne.*
107.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I am here for Duke Ulder Ravengard. Show me the way!

69.speaker: Wyll

69.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

54.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
54.text: The duke? I mean, if you see him, let him know I'm down for a drink, but he ain't here.
54.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

159.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
159.text: Which begs the question, what are you bloody doing down here?
159.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

22.speaker: Player
22.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

30.speaker: Player
30.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

77.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
77.text: The only port in this whole bleedin' city that matters. Now why are you here? Did Gortash send you?

85.speaker: Player
85.text: That submersible - why is it here? What is this place?
85.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

192.text: Boss sent me to check up on the situation down here.

80.text: Boss sent me to check up on the situation down here.
80.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

66.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
66.text: No news is good news, right? Especially with the rough water between here and the Iron Throne.
66.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

61.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
61.text: No news is good news, right? Especially with the rough water between here and the Iron Throne.
61.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

81.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
81.text: No prisoners lost in the last batch of runs, either, though them servants of Umberlee are making the trip damn near deadly.
81.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

200.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
200.text: Bloody salties are always flopping around in the water - I've almost hit one or two now. Might've even nicked one off the port bow the other day.

120.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
120.text: Maybe that'll teach 'em to keep out the way.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: The Iron Throne? That's just the place I need. What do you know?
184.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

60.text: I've never heard of this Iron Throne.
60.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

74.text: I need to get to the Iron Throne.

14.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
14.text: I'll take you in. But look - there's some bad shit going down in there. You don't want to get involved. Neither did I, but it was them or me.

202.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
202.text: I'll get Cap warmed up. Get in when you're ready.

0.text: You're meant to go to the Iron Throne, and I'm the King of the Sword Coast.

49.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
49.text: You're meant to go to the Iron Throne, and I'm the King of the Sword Coast.

50.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
50.text: Don't know what your game is, but I don't want to be involved. Bye.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: Please. There's something I need to do in the Throne - something Lord Gortash doesn't need to know about.
199.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

57.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
57.text: Ooh, the jableedas on you. Look, I don't want any trouble - but I know old Gortash is up to some mad shit in there.
57.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

188.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
188.text: Ooh, the jableedas on you. Look, I don't want any trouble - but I know old Gortash is up to some mad shit in there.
188.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

40.text: You must take me for a fool. I ain't going against Gortash for the likes of you. No way.

36.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
36.text: You must take me for a fool. I ain't going against Gortash for the likes of you. No way.

190.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
190.text: Feck off while you still can.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: Don't know what to tell you. He sent me ahead and said your payment would follow.

157.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
157.text: Huh. Not like him to surprise me. But - mad times.

117.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
117.text: Huh. Not like him to surprise me. But - mad times.

132.text: Sure he did, buddy. Sure he did.

125.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
125.text: Sure he did, buddy. Sure he did.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Boss doesn't need to know - and I'll make your discretion worth your while. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_5_8860ed48-ba5f-4b7b-82bf-f1220f967d41])

193.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
193.text: Well. Now you're speaking my language.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I know the followers of Umberlee want you dead. Take me there now, and I won't lead them to you.

191.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
191.text: Gondians, mostly. Collateral to keep those working in the Steel Watch Foundry under control.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: You killed one of those servants of Umberlee. Now they want you dead.

59.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
59.text: Oh yeah? And are you here to make good on that?

203.speaker: Player
203.text: Depends. Tell me everything you know about the Iron Throne.

41.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
41.text: It's an underwater prison - most secure in the Realms. Myself and Cap are the only ones who can make it there in one piece.

87.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
87.text: Lord Gortash keeps some Gondians there. Collateral to keep those working in the Steel Watch Foundry under control.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: Ulder Ravengard is here - he must be.

207.speaker: Wyll
207.text: Ulder Ravengard is here - he must be.

150.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
150.text: If he is, that's Lord Gortash's business - I don't ask questions.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: If you take me to the Iron Throne, I could 'forget' I saw you.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I'll make you a deal - take me to the Iron Throne, and I'll protect you from Umberlee's servants.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: You're going to take me to the Iron Throne - I'm getting the prisoners out.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: You're as guilty as the people who imprisoned the Gondians.

205.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
205.text: And you're the judge, jury, and executioner, is that it? Yeah right. Say goodbye, kid.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: You killed someone. You need to face justice.

6.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
6.text: Right. Well you can tell Lord Gortash all's well. Water's real rough between here and the Iron Throne, but we're making it work.

110.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
110.text: Now, I know you're nothing but a grifter. Spill it - what are you after?

148.speaker: Player
148.text: I need to go to the Iron Throne - and I'm willing to pay. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I just want to know what happens in this port.

189.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
189.text: Nothing without Lord Gortash's go-ahead. I transport whoever he needs taken to the Iron Throne.

25.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
25.text: It's an underwater prison - most secure in the Realms.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Orin the Red - what do you take me for?

42.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
42.text: Ha! An absolute chancer. Spill it - what are you really after?

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Haven't you heard? I'm the new waterway inspector!
18.context: NodeContext: Gestures below him, to the submersible under his feet.

151.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
151.text: No one tells me anything. Last I heard Lord Gortash handles this port's inspections personally.

35.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
35.text: No one tells me anything. Last I heard Lord Gortash handles this port's inspections personally.

174.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
174.text: Anyway, if you're in charge of the waterways, you got a lot of work to do. Those Umberlee servants are making the trip to the Iron Throne damn near deadly.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: What goes on in the Iron Throne?

152.speaker: Player
152.text: As it happens, I'll be needing a ride to the Iron Throne. As part of my inspection.

147.text: You're a waterway inspector, and I'm Sarevok's last son. What are you really doing here?

178.text: You're a waterway inspector, and I'm Sarevok's last son. What are you really doing here?

158.text: Let me guess. This is about them Umberlee servants.

44.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
44.text: You tell them to stay out of the way. Cap needs the right-of-way - he can't stop on a dime when they go darting in front of the prow.
44.context: NodeContext: Gestures below him, to the submersible under his feet.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: What do you mean about Umberlee's servants getting in your way?
91.context: NodeContext: Gestures below him, to the submersible under his feet.

123.speaker: Player
123.context: NodeContext: Gestures below him, to the submersible under his feet.

13.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
13.text: This big boy - the Captain of Grey Harbour. Built him with my own two hands. Can take the passage between here and the Iron Throne faster than you can say 'fuck the Absolute'.
13.context: NodeContext: Gestures below him, to the submersible under his feet.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: What goes on at this port?

112.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
112.text: Nothing without Lord Gortash's go-ahead. I transport whoever he needs taken to the Iron Throne. Prisoners, mostly. But that's his business.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: The Iron Throne? That's just the place I need. What do you know?

138.text: It seems you and 'Cap' killed a servant of Umberlee on one of your latest runs. Now they want you dead.

23.text: Uh-huh. Why don't you stop the bluster and tell me what you actually want?

17.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
17.text: Uh-huh. Why don't you stop the bluster and tell me what you actually want?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I'm looking for some hostages. Brought into the Iron Throne by an underwater passage.

134.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
134.text: Well. Me and Cap don't know a thing about that.

179.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser

186.speaker: Player
186.text: Take me to the Iron Throne, and I won't blame you for your involvement.

72.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
72.text: Listen, I just do what I'm told. All right?

195.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
195.text: Listen, I just do what I'm told. All right?

83.text: I don't know who you are, but I know a bluff when I see one. Get lost.

89.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
89.text: I don't know who you are, but I know a bluff when I see one. Get lost.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Please. Those people are in real danger.

169.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
169.text: Look. I don't want anyone to get hurt. But I've got to do what I've got to do, same as anyone.

165.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
165.text: Look. I don't want anyone to get hurt. But I've got to do what I've got to do, same as anyone.

198.text: Wake up, chief. We're all in danger these days. I ain't risking my neck for anyone but me.

170.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
170.text: Wake up, chief. We're all in danger these days. I ain't risking my neck for anyone but me.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I'm here for Duke Ulder Ravengard. Take me to him.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I know you hid hostages. Is Ravengard among them?

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Sorry, I just got turned around.

111.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
111.text: Like I've never heard that one before. Get lost.

196.speaker: Narrator
196.text: *You spot a curious metal contraption in the water - a submersible.*

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Take me to the Iron Throne. I'm willing to pay. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Take me to the Iron Throne now.

26.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
26.text: Get out of my feckin' face with that.

109.text: Get out of my feckin' face with that.

116.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
116.text: Get out of my feckin' face with that.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: You mentioned Cap - who did you mean again?

93.speaker: Player
93.text: What exactly goes on at this port?
